org.js4ms.amt.gateway

Class AmtDatagramSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.js4ms.io.channel.MessageSource<UdpDatagram>
      • org.js4ms.amt.gateway.AmtDatagramSource

  • public class AmtDatagramSource
extends MessageSource<UdpDatagram>
    A MessageSource that constructs an AMT multicast endpoint to forward datagrams sent to a specific port and one or more any-source or source-specific addresses. The multicast group and source addresses are specified when an instance is constructed using a SourceFilter object.

    Forwarding can be enabled or disabled using the MessageSource.start() and MessageSource.stop() methods.

    Author:
    Greg Bumgardner (gbumgard)

    • Constructor Detail

      • AmtDatagramSource

        public AmtDatagramSource(int destinationPort,
                 SourceFilter sourceFilter,
                 OutputChannel<UdpDatagram> outputChannel)
                  throws IOException
        Constructs a message source for UDP datagrams sent to a multicast address.
        Parameters:
        destinationPort - The destination port of the UDP stream.
        sourceFilter - A source filter that identifies the any-source multicast (ASM) or source-specific multicast (SSM) destination address and source host address(es) of the UDP datagrams. The source filter mode in each group record is ignored (assumed to be INCLUDE).
        outputChannel - The channel that will receive datagrams as they arrive.
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurred while constructing the AMT endpoint.

      • AmtDatagramSource

        public AmtDatagramSource(int destinationPort,
                 SourceFilter sourceFilter,
                 InetAddress relayDiscoveryAddress,
                 OutputChannel<UdpDatagram> outputChannel)
                  throws IOException
        Constructs a message source for UDP datagrams sent to a multicast address.
        Parameters:
        destinationPort - The destination port of the UDP stream.
        sourceFilter - A source filter that identifies the any-source multicast (ASM) or source-specific multicast (SSM) destination address and source host address(es) of the UDP datagrams. The source filter mode in each group record is ignored (assumed to be INCLUDE).
        relayDiscoveryAddress - The anycast or unicast address used to locate an AMT relay.
        outputChannel - The channel that will receive datagrams as they arrive.
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurred while constructing the AMT endpoint.
